alert.note: Alert for Kahoolawe in Maui (Hawaii) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued January 28 at 3:35PM HST until January 28 at 6:45PM HST by NWS Honolulu
info.description: The National Weather Service in Honolulu has extended the * Flash Flood Warning for... The island of Molokai in Maui County * Until 645 PM HST. * At 335 PM HST, radar indicated heavy rain over Molokai with rainfall rates of 1 to 2 inches per hour. Maui County Emergency Management has reported overflowing streams and homes flooded in the Kawela Gulch area. A shelter has been opened near Kaunakakai. Rain rates are expected to diminish in the short term, but could redevelop quickly over the next few hours. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by heavy rain. SOURCE...Emergency management. IMPACT...Flooding in drainages, streams, rivers, roads, properties, and other low-lying areas. Public road closures possible in some areas. Landslides are possible in steep terrain. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... the entire island of Molokai. This warning may need to be extended beyond 645 PM HST if flooding persists. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED
info.instruction: Stay away from streams, rivers, drainage ditches, and culverts, even if they are currently dry. Do not cross fast flowing or rising water in your vehicle, or on foot. Turn around, don`t drown.
